seriesJson.title: People talk back
seriesJson.description: This series presents a series of questions posed to politicians about current affairs.

node.title: Ethics in government, part two
node.description: This program, the second of three parts, explores "Ethics in Government"  with Senator Paul H. Douglas of Illinois.

node.title: Radio-TV:  In the halls of Congress?, part two
node.description: In this program, the second of three parts, citizens talk back to Sen. Wallace F. Bennett of Utah about the debate over whether or not to broadcast sessions in Congress over radio and television.

subject.name: United States. Congress. House--Radio broadcasting of proceedings.
United States. Congress. House--Television broadcasting of proceedings.

node.title: Is our immigration law meeting our needs or prejudices?, part three
node.description: This program, the third of three parts,  features Professor Oscar Handlin and U.S. Representative F. E. Walter of Pennsylvania discussing what citizens have to say about Immigration and Nationality Act of 1952.

node.title: Is our immigration law meeting our needs or prejudices?, part one
node.description: This program, the first of three parts,  features Professor Oscar Handlin and U.S. Representative F. E. Walter of Pennsylvania discussing what citizens have to say about Immigration and Nationality Act of 1952.

node.title: Is our immigration law meeting our needs or prejudices?, part two
node.description: This program, the second of three parts,  features Professor Oscar Handlin and U.S. Representative F. E. Walter of Pennsylvania discussing what citizens have to say about Immigration and Nationality Act of 1952.

node.title: Can we live in peace with the Soviet Union?, part one
node.description: In this program, the first of two parts, four American journalists speak to British Labor leader Aneurin Bevan.

node.title: Can we live in peace with the Soviet Union?, part two
node.description: In this program, the second of two parts, four American journalists speak to British Labor leader Aneurin Bevan.
